lead_paragraph: A judge closed a case against retired police and military officers accused of abducting Boris Weisfeiler, who vanished in Chile during the Pinochet dictatorship, a mystery that may never be solved.

headline.print_headline: Chile Halts Inquiry on Missing American
headline.main: Chile Halts Inquiry on American Who Disappeared 31 Years Ago

snippet: A judge closed a case against retired police and military officers accused of abducting Boris Weisfeiler, who vanished in Chile during the Pinochet dictatorship, a mystery that may never be solved.
abstract: Chilean judge ends inquiry into 1984 disappearance of Penn State professor Boris Weisfeiler during hiking tour of southern Chile, citing statute of limitations on case; investigation had suggested he was abducted by government agents and murdered by Germans loyal to Pinochet regime; victim's supporters are outraged over decision they claim compromises strides country's justice system has made towards prosecuting human rights cases.
